creator: c.siedentop@ndh.net
text:
Hello batik-team,

first of all: the programms makes a lot of fun. I use it for my first steps 
with svg (since 3 days). I found the following reproducible problem.

What happened:
I use the SvgViewer, load the textRotateShadows.svg from the samples and the  
graphic was rendered very well. Then I switched the solution of the screen from 
1024x768 (true-color) to 800x600 (true-color) and with that action the java 
runtime hangs up. (The windows task-manager say's "no response".)

I tried this again and can't reproduce the effect. I tried it a third time and 
the application died again. 
I had success (to reproduce the bug) when I opened two batik-application with 
different sources and switched from 1024x768 to 800x600. 
I also was able, to let the SvgViewer hang up, when I switched from 800x600 to 
640x480. 

With further investigations I could reproduce this misbehaviour often but not 
alwys. It does not depend on the kind of the loaded-svg source. (Therefore I 
opened two instances of batik, loaded the same svg-source and switched the
screen solution. Then only one window hangs up.)

I opened two instances of batik with different svg-sources, switched the screen 
solution and both instances hang up.


Here are my system data:

Windows NT4 with SP6, 
SUN JDK1.3.0rc2, 
Batik-1_1rc3, 
The source was not zoomed.

---

This is my first bug report in an open source project. I read the bug writing 
guidelines before and I hope the description is useful for the team.

Thank you for your work, much fun and good luck for finding bugs.

Carsten

Changing the screen resolution on Windows 2000 while Batik is running works.
We were not able to reproduce the problem.

I don't know for windows NT.
We are using the jdk1.3.1
